While walking through a remote path, Lucas stumbled upon an old cabin that wasn’t marked on any of his maps. Curious and a bit cautious, he approached it. To his surprise, the door was unlocked and there was fresh food on the table inside. It was clear someone had been there recently, but no one was around. Suddenly, a friendly dog came running toward him, wagging its tail. The dog led Lucas further into the woods, where he found an elderly man who had lived there in isolation for over a decade. They spoke for hours. The man shared stories of his decision to leave the city behind and live in peace with nature. Lucas returned home a few days later, deeply inspired. He now volunteers for environmental causes and says that meeting that man changed his perspective on life. It sounds like something out of a moviebut he swears it’s all true.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Among the nine writing techniques introduced, **focused free writing** and **questioning** stand out as particularly useful to me. Focused free writing allows for a flow of thoughts without the pressure of structure, which can be very helpful when brainstorming or working through writer’s block. I find that it often leads to unexpected ideas and connections that I might not have considered otherwise. By writing freely on a topic for a set amount of time, I can uncover deeper thoughts and insights that might otherwise remain hidden.

On the other hand, **questioning** is another technique that I often use, especially when I want to dive deeper into a subject or explore different angles of a topic. Asking questions helps to refine the direction of my writing and can lead to more focused, meaningful content. It’s also a great way to clarify ideas and challenge assumptions, which ultimately strengthens the overall writing.

Both techniques help me stay engaged in the writing process, fostering creativity and improving clarity. Together, they provide a strong foundation for exploring and developing ideas effectively.

Response: Developing leadership qualities takes time, self-awareness, and a willingness to grow. One of the most important qualities in a leader is the ability to listen—really listen—to others. I’ve seen people become great leaders simply because they took the time to understand their team’s concerns and needs. Another key quality is responsibility. A true leader takes ownership of their actions and decisions, even when things go wrong.

Confidence is also important, but it should come with humility. Some of the most respected leaders I know admit when they don’t know something and ask for help. I’ve personally grown as a leader by stepping out of my comfort zone, learning from mistakes, and being open to feedback.
I believe everyone has the potential to be a leader in some area of life. Leadership doesn’t always mean being in charge—it can also mean setting a good example, offering support, or inspiring others. With effort, reflection, and a desire to make a difference, anyone can develop strong leadership qualities.

Write an email to the boss describing two challenges and solutions. Type in the input box. Write 75-130 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: Dear John,
As we navigate through an increasingly digital world, I wanted to share some thoughts on the dual-edged impact of technology on our business landscape.

On one hand, the rapid advancement of technology presents significant challenges that we must be prepared to face. Automation and artificial intelligence are transforming industries, streamlining processes, and enhancing productivity. However, this shift also raises concerns regarding job displacement and the potential for reduced human involvement in various roles. As certain tasks become automated, we may witness a decline in traditional job opportunities, particularly in sectors that rely heavily on routine functions.

On the other hand, this technological evolution also creates a wealth of opportunities. New fields and industries are emerging, driven by innovation and the growing demand for new skill sets. While some jobs may become obsolete, many new roles are being created in areas such as data analysis, cybersecurity, and technology management. Our ability to adapt and reskill our workforce will be crucial in harnessing these opportunities.

To thrive in this changing environment, we must remain proactive. Emphasizing continuous learning and development will not only prepare our team for the challenges ahead but also position us to take advantage of new opportunities that technology will inevitably bring.

In conclusion, while the future of technology poses certain dangers, it also holds immense potential for growth and innovation. By staying informed and adaptable, we can navigate this transition effectively, ensuring that our business remains competitive in the face of change.

I look forward to discussing this further with you.

Best regards,

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade pact signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, which came into effect on January 1, 1994. NAFTA aimed to eliminate most tariffs and trade barriers between the three countries, creating one of the largest free-trade zones in the world. The agreement was inspired by the success of the European Economic Community and sought to boost economic growth and job creation through increased trade and investment.

NAFTA's main provisions included the gradual reduction of tariffs, customs duties, and other trade barriers over a period of up to 15 years. This allowed for duty-free access to a wide range of goods and services, fostering economic integration among the member countries. The agreement also included side agreements on labor and environmental standards to address concerns about the potential negative impacts of increased trade.

Despite facing significant opposition and political debates, NAFTA was generally seen as beneficial for the North American economies. It facilitated the flow of goods, services, and capital, contributing to economic growth and higher living standards. However, it also had its critics, who argued that it led to job losses in certain industries exposed to trade competition.

In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which aimed to modernize and update the trade relationship between the three countries.
text_b: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade pact signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, which came into effect on January 1, 1994. NAFTA aimed to eliminate most tariffs and trade barriers between the three countries, creating one of the largest free-trade zones in the world. The agreement was inspired by the success of the European Economic Community and sought to boost economic growth and job creation through increased trade and investment. NAFTA's main provisions included the gradual reduction of tariffs, customs duties, and other trade barriers over a period of up to 15 years. This allowed for duty-free access to a wide range of goods and services, fostering economic integration among the member countries. The agreement also included side agreements on labor and environmental standards to address concerns about the potential negative impacts of increased trade. Despite facing significant opposition and political debates, NAFTA was generally seen as beneficial for the North American economies. It facilitated the flow of goods, services, and capital, contributing to economic growth and higher living standards. However, it also had its critics, who argued that it led to job losses in certain industries exposed to trade competition. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which aimed to modernize and update the trade relationship between the three countries.

<input>Subject: You Won't Believe What Happened!

Hey Lisa,

I hope you're doing well! I just had the craziest experience last weekend, and I couldn't wait to share it with you. So, I decided to take a spontaneous road trip to the countryside because, well, why not? I packed a few essentials, hopped in my car, and set off on an adventure.

Walking alongside those majestically awkward creatures was surreal and utterly delightful. I spent the rest of the day exploring the town's eclectic shops and sampling homemade fudge from a quaint little bakery.

It was such an unexpected and joyful day. Let me know when you're free—I have so many pictures to show you!

Love,
Damian</input>

Provide specific examples of how the program will deliver greater ROI, such as reducing costs, improving customer satisfaction, or enhancing supply chain visibility.

Ensure compatibility with evolving technology standards.

Request a detailed breakdown of costs and potential savings to justify the investment.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: You’re writing a brief performance review of your sales team member Oliver. Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words. Response: **Performance Review Report for Oliver Murray**

**Employee:** Oliver Murray  
**Review Period:** one year  
**Reviewer:** Anastasi Mary  

**Overview:**
Oliver has been with the company for a year and has demonstrated significant potential in his role. His performance has reflected both strong contributions and areas for improvement.

**Strengths:**
- **Strong Start:** Oliver had an impressive beginning to his tenure, quickly adapting and showing a genuine eagerness to succeed.
- **Innovative Thinking:** He consistently brings interesting and creative ideas to the table, showcasing his ability to think outside the box.
- **Work Ethic:** Oliver is known for his diligent work habits, often going above and beyond to ensure tasks are completed effectively.
- **Attention to Detail:** He has made very few mistakes in his work, demonstrating a high level of competence.
- **Cost-Saving Initiative:** Notably, Oliver identified and corrected a product error that resulted in significant cost savings for the company.
- **Recognition:** He has been awarded Employee of the Month twice within the year and received a promotion after just six months, highlighting his strong performance and impact.

**Areas for Improvement:**

- **Team Collaboration:** There's an opportunity for Oliver to think more about the team's dynamics and to engage more collaboratively with his colleagues.

**Goals for Next Period:**
1. **Fix Deadline Management Issues:** Work on strategies to improve the ability to meet deadlines consistently and communicate any potential challenges to the team promptly.
2. **Enhance Team Collaboration:** Develop a more team-oriented approach by participating in team discussions and considering the impact of his work on colleagues and team goals.

**Conclusion:**
Overall, Oliver Murray has had an outstanding year marked by many achievements and a few areas needing attention. With a focus on improving his deadline management and team collaboration, I am confident that he will continue to thrive and contribute significantly to our team's success.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: An airplane is a complex machine composed of several essential components, each playing a crucial role in ensuring its functionality and ability to fly. At the core is the fuselage, the main body of the aircraft, which houses the cockpit, passenger cabin, and cargo space. The cockpit contains the controls and navigation systems, enabling pilots to operate the airplane. The fuselage's structure is designed to withstand pressure differences during flight, ensuring passenger safety and comfort.
The wings are perhaps the most critical elements for flight. Their aerodynamic shape creates lift by generating lower pressure on the upper surface and higher pressure underneath. Flaps and ailerons on the wings further enhance control during takeoff, landing, and turns.
The tail assembly, also known as the empennage, provides stability. It includes the vertical stabilizer, which prevents side-to-side motion, and the horizontal stabilizer, which manages pitch control.
Finally, engines, whether jet or propeller-based, generate the thrust necessary for forward motion. Together, these parts harmonize to enable safe and efficient air travel.
text_b: An airplane is a complex machine composed of several essential components, each playing a crucial role in ensuring its functionality and ability to fly. At the core is the fuselage, the main body of the aircraft, which houses the cockpit, passenger cabin, and cargo space. The cockpit contains the controls and navigation systems, enabling pilots to operate the airplane. The fuselage's structure is designed to withstand pressure differences during flight, ensuring passenger safety and comfort. The wings are perhaps the most critical elements for flight. Their aerodynamic shape creates lift by generating lower pressure on the upper surface and higher pressure underneath. Flaps and ailerons on the wings further enhance control during takeoff, landing, and turns. The tail assembly, also known as the empennage, provides stability. It includes the vertical stabilizer, which prevents side-to-side motion, and the horizontal stabilizer, which manages pitch control. Finally, engines, whether jet or propeller-based, generate the thrust necessary for forward motion. Together, these parts harmonize to enable safe and efficient air travel.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: El Coco is a well-known legendary creature often used by parents as a cautionary tale to encourage children to behave.  Parents often use the story of El Coco to scare children so they behave well. The creature is said to come at night to take away disobedient or sleepless children who do not go to bed or who misbehave. Though it is rarely described in detail, El Coco is typically imagined as a dark, shadowy monster that hides in closets or under beds, waiting for the right moment to appear.
El Coco is not always described the same way. Sometimes it looks like a monster with big eyes and sharp teeth. Other times, it is just a shadow or a ghost that hides under the bed or in the closet. Because of this, children are often afraid of the dark.
The story of El Coco has been told for hundreds of years . The legend of El Coco has deep roots in Spain and is passed down from generation to generation. One of the most famous references says: “Duérmete niño, que viene el Coco.” This phrase, which means “Sleep, child, or the Coco will come,” This shows how popular and old the legend is.
Even today, many people in Spain still know about El Coco. It represents a way for adults to teach children the importance of rules and bedtime. Today, El Coco remains a powerful cultural symbol and a reminder of how myths and stories shape behavior and tradition.

text_a: Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Now prepare the content for an informative web page about counterfeit goods. Be sure to keep the following points in mind: Types of counterfeit goods, the effect of counterfeiting on society, the signs of a fake, what to do if you discover fake goods.  Write 250-300 words. Response: nan
text_b: Understanding Counterfeit Goods: Protecting yourself and society Counterfeit goods are products made to imitate real, branded items with the intention of deceiving consumers. These goods are often sold at a fraction of the price of the authentic items, but they pose serious risks to both individuals and society. Here's everything you neeed to know to spot and avoid counterfeit products.´ Types of Counterfeit Goods Counterfeit goods cover a wide range of products, including: Fashion items: Fake designer clothing, shoes, and accessories. Electronics: Counterfeit phones, laptops, chargersand other gadgets. Pharmaceuticals: Fake prescription drugs that can harm your health. Cosmetics: Imitation beauty products that may contain harmful ingredients. Food and beverages: COunterfeit food products that could be unsafe to consume. The effect of counterfeiting on society: Counterfeiting is not just a financial issue-it can have severe social consequences. The production and sale of counterfeit goods support criminal organizations and contribute to illegal activities. THse fake products often fail to meet safety standars, putting consumers at risk. In the case of counterfeit pharmaceuticals, for example, they can lead to health complications or even fatalieties. Furthermore, counterfeiting undermines legitimate businesses, resulting in job losses and economic damage. Signs of a fake product Recognizing counterfeit goods can be challenging, but there are key signs to watch out for: Price: If the deal seems too good to be true, it probably is. Packaging: Look the poorly printed labels, misspeleed brand names, or incorrect font Quality: Inferior materials or construction are common in counterfeit good Serial numbers: Authentic products often have unique serail numbers or security features..

As the Falcon ML landed, its left landing gear experienced a minor issue which made it come slightly off-center while on the ground. End of report.

Some critics believe that the real responsibility of business is to increase its profits and that business is not answerable to society's expectations but to the shareholders. While it may be true that the first goal of companies is to make profits, it doesn’t mean that they don’t care about the impact of their actions. We must remember that usually this is a win-win situation. They are helping the communities where they operate as they are letting them do business there. Also if consumers are happy, they will reward companies with their loyalty. And it's the same with sustainable operations and fair employee benefits. In a way that will secure future possibilities and ensure high productivity and low turnover.

To sum up, I believe CSR should be an essential part of business operations. Consistent adherence to corporate social responsibility principles can help the company and its shareholders, as well as people in need in the local community and around the world.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Custom instruction:
Based on the notes, prepare one or two points each for the Method, Findings, Conclusions and Recommendations parts of the summary report. Write 100–175 words. Response: Summary Report on Collarless Dress Shirt Survey

Methods:
The survey was conducted in two major cities, Rio de Janeiro and Shanghai, with a sample size of 1000 participants in each location. The sample covered all demographics to ensure a comprehensive understanding of the population's opinion on the collarless dress shirt. Participants were asked how they felt about the product, including whether they would consider purchasing it.

Findings:
In Rio de Janeiro, 35% of respondents approved of the collarless dress shirt, with 20% indicating they would buy it. Conversely, 65% did not approve. In Shanghai, the approval rate was significantly higher at 80%, with 40% willing to purchase the shirt, while 20% did not approve. The primary reasons for disapproval in both cities included issues with design, size, color, and material.

Conclusions:
The survey results indicate a stark contrast between the two cities. While the collarless dress shirt received a favorable response in Shanghai, it was not well-received in Rio de Janeiro. The feedback suggests that the product's design and execution did not meet the expectations of a significant portion of the respondents. Additionally, the lack of diversity consideration in the product design was a common concern.

Recommendations:
To improve the product's acceptance, it is recommended to conduct more in-depth market research to understand what men want and need in an accessory. Enhancements in design should focus on attention to detail, such as stitching color. The size should be adjusted to offer a slim fit, and the color options should include strong primary colors as well as black and white. The material should be wrinkle-free and/or sweat absorbent. Prioritizing changes for the Rio de Janeiro market is crucial, as the results from Asia are already satisfactory.

If you have any queries or need further information, please do not hesitate to contact James Tufnell, Head of Research.

Response: In order for someone to develop leadership qualities, it requires a combination of personal growth, experience, and the ability to inspire others. From my own experience as a project manager, I have learned that good leaders must be confident, decisive, and able to communicate their thoughts clearly. One of the most important qualities of a leader is the ability to motivate a team and create a positive work environment. A leader should also be adaptable, willing to learn from mistakes, and open to feedback.

I have observed that the best leaders lead by example. They do not just give orders but actively participate in problem-solving and decision-making. 
Leadership is not about authority but about inspiring trust and respect. With the right mindset and continuous learning, anyone has the potential to become a great leader. Finally, we should not forget that leading a team carries a great responsibility and has a lot of stress! A good leader should also have the physical characteristics to be able to manage stress.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The Aswang, a creature of Philippine folklore, is a terrifying shapeshifter that embodies the darkest fears of rural communities. Unlike a single entity, the Aswang is a broad classification for various monstrous beings, often female, that can transform into animals like large dogs, pigs, or birds, most notably a large, predatory bird with a long proboscis.

What makes the Aswang particularly horrifying is its predilection for human flesh, especially that of unborn babies and young children. It's said they can detach their upper torso from their lower body, growing bat-like wings to fly at night, searching for victims. The sound of a "tik-tik" noise is believed to herald their approach, a sound used to lull victims into a false sense of security.

The Aswang's legend is deeply rooted in anxieties surrounding pregnancy, vulnerability, and the unknown. They are often portrayed as ordinary people during the day, making them difficult to identify, adding to the pervasive fear. Belief in the Aswang persists in many rural areas, and it serves as a cautionary tale, reinforcing social norms and highlighting the importance of protecting the vulnerable.

Here are some important points for motivating your team staff. This is an important part of making them feel part of the company:

- Talk to them frequently, don't act distant.
- Care about their well-being inside and outside the company
- Create development and training plans
- Trust in their work
- Incentivize your employees in some way or another proportional to their work. This will help build trust and a sense of belonging to the company.
- Each member of your team is different. Managing a team of people isn't easy, but getting to know each member helps build trust and closeness.

- Don't disrespect them (not their work either)
- Don't congratulate them on the work they've done
- And under no circumstances should you lose your temper.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: Out of the nine writing techniques introduced, **free writing** and **loop writing** seem the most useful to me. Free writing allows for a continuous flow of ideas without worrying about structure or grammar, which can be incredibly helpful when I'm trying to overcome writer’s block or generate ideas for a larger project. It gives me the freedom to explore thoughts without the pressure of making them perfect, and often, the best ideas emerge from this unfiltered process. Similarly, **loop writing** appeals to me because it helps refine ideas as I go. By starting with a broad concept and then narrowing it down as I loop back and revisit the writing, I can clarify my message and make my points more cohesive. This technique encourages me to reflect on what I’ve written and improve upon it as I progress, which leads to a more polished and thought-out piece in the end. Both techniques allow for creative exploration and refinement, making them ideal tools when working through complex topics or when I'm just beginning to draft an idea.

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The Day Tom Became a "Hero"

Last weekend, my friend Tom experienced the most ridiculous but hilarious situation of his life. It all started when he decided to impress his crush, Lisa, by rescuing a "trapped" kitten from a tree.

As Tom confidently climbed up, he realized two things: first, the kitten wasn’t actually stuck—it was just chilling; second, he had no idea how to get back down. The kitten, completely uninterested in his heroic act, casually jumped to the ground and walked away, leaving Tom clinging to a branch, calling for help.

A group of children gathered below, laughing and taking videos. An old lady even shouted, "Hold on, young man, I’ll call the fire department!" That’s when Tom panicked. Not wanting to be rescued like a helpless cat, he attempted to climb down himself—only to lose his grip and fall straight into a bush.

Luckily, he wasn’t hurt—just covered in leaves and embarrassment. Lisa? Well, she laughed so hard that she actually agreed to go on a date with him. So, in a way, his “heroic” moment was a success!
text_b: The Day Tom Became a "Hero" Last weekend, my friend Tom experienced the most ridiculous but hilarious situation of his life. It all started when he decided to impress his crush, Lisa, by rescuing a "trapped" kitten from a tree. As Tom confidently climbed up, he realized two things: first, the kitten wasn’t actually stuck—it was just chilling; second, he had no idea how to get back down. The kitten, completely uninterested in his heroic act, casually jumped to the ground and walked away, leaving Tom clinging to a branch, calling for help. A group of children gathered below, laughing and taking videos. An old lady even shouted, "Hold on, young man, I’ll call the fire department!" That’s when Tom panicked. Not wanting to be rescued like a helpless cat, he attempted to climb down himself—only to lose his grip and fall straight into a bush. Luckily, he wasn’t hurt—just covered in leaves and embarrassment. Lisa? Well, she laughed so hard that she actually agreed to go on a date with him. So, in a way, his “heroic” moment was a success!

The first time, due to bad weather conditions, the ATC asked the pilot to continue indicating strong crosswinds over the runway, so the pilot had to go around and wait for clearance to land. After some timethe ATC indicated to the pilot landing clearance, but this time during approximation to the runway the pilot observed an issue when extending the landing gear. He was expecting a three-green position indicator, but he got a red indicator instead, so he had to inform the ATC that he was going around. Finally, after returning the landing gear to the up-locked position and then after a second attempt, he got a three-green indicator and requested landing clearance to the ATC and was able to land safely.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: Robots have become a pervasive and an increasingly integral part of our society and daily lives. The use of artificial intelligence has allowed for a faster and more efficient way to build robots, effectively increasing automation in many industries. Robots can offer increased productivity, efficiency, quality, and consistency. Robots can't get bored with their job. Until they switch off, they can repeat the same task continuously. Robots can be very accurate than humans, that's why robots are used in the manufacturing of microelectronics. From the one hand, robots could take on some of the most strenuous, physically intensiveand risky tasksreducing workers' risk. On the other hand, the competition with robots may increase the pressure on workers who may lose their jobs or be forced to retrain. AI is a machine, and machines do not have emotions. They can simulate emotions to some extent, but they do not actually feel them. Emotions are a complex mix of physiological and psychological responses to external stimuli. And machines simply do not have the necessary biology or consciousness to experience them. Sorobots have both positive and negative impacts.

text_a: Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Think of something weird, exciting or funny that happened to you recently, and describe it in an email to a friend. Make it interesting and descriptive, and remember to check for pronoun reference. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b:
<input>Hey John,

I hope you're doing great! I just had to share the most incredible experience I had recently at the Azteca Stadium. It was the final match of the Mexican Soccer League, and my team was playing. Let me tell you, it was an emotional rollercoaster!

The atmosphere was electric from the moment I stepped into the stadium. The crowd was a sea of colors, and the energy was palpable. Just as the match started, the skies opened up, and it began to pour. I was soaked within minutes, but the excitement of the game kept me warm.

The match was intense! Both teams were playing their hearts out, and every pass had us on the edge of our seats. In the final minutes, just when it seemed like it would end in a draw, my team scored a sensational goal. The stadium erupted in cheers, and I found myself jumping up and down, drenched but ecstatic.

Despite the rain, it was one of the most thrilling nights of my life. The joy of seeing my team lift the trophy made every drop worth it. Can't wait to catch up and tell you more about it!

Best,
David.</input>

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The modern obsession with celebrity culture often feels like a publicity stunt that distracts us from more important issues. Many celebrities are media-savvy, constantly using the spotlight to bad-mouth others or endorse products without genuine conviction. This constant need to stay in the limelight can make some stars seem media-hogging, prioritizing fame over talent or meaningful contribution.

Moreover, celebrity egos often need to be taken down a peg or two because their arrogance can overshadow their actual abilities. The voguish bandwagon of chasing fame leads many to forget true values, as superficial appearances become more important than substance. This creates a culture where even those with flagging careers try desperate moves to regain attention, often compromising their authenticity.

Ultimately, the celebrity phenomenon can promote unrealistic standards and distract society with edutainment that is entertaining but shallow. We should be cautious about idolizing individuals whose innate benevolence might be overshadowed by media manipulation and superficial publicity.
text_b: The modern obsession with celebrity culture often feels like a publicity stunt that distracts us from more important issues. Many celebrities are media-savvy, constantly using the spotlight to bad-mouth others or endorse products without genuine conviction. This constant need to stay in the limelight can make some stars seem media-hogging, prioritizing fame over talent or meaningful contribution. Moreover, celebrity egos often need to be taken down a peg or two because their arrogance can overshadow their actual abilities. The voguish bandwagon of chasing fame leads many to forget true values, as superficial appearances become more important than substance. This creates a culture where even those with flagging careers try desperate moves to regain attention, often compromising their authenticity. Ultimately, the celebrity phenomenon can promote unrealistic standards and distract society with edutainment that is entertaining but shallow. We should be cautious about idolizing individuals whose innate benevolence might be overshadowed by media manipulation and superficial publicity.

text_b: Training Company Evaluation: TrainQuick vs. Skills Pro After evaluating two potential training providers, TrainQuick and Skills Pro, it is clear that while both offer distinct advantages, Skills Pro stands out as the more suitable option for our needs. TrainQuick offers a more affordable and flexible training solution, but its adoption has been limited in the other branch, and employees have expressed dissatisfaction when mixed with participants from different branches. This has created a sense of disengagement, impacting the overall effectiveness of the training. On the other hand, Skills Pro is more expensive but offers a higher level of quality in its courses. Despite the content being perceived as challenging, employees who complete the course often finish successfully, suggesting that the difficulty level is appropriate for fostering deep learning. Furthermore, Skills Pro plans to expand its course offerings, which could provide valuable opportunities for continued professional development. Given the importance of investing in high-quality training, particularly in areas critical to our growth, Skills Pro is the recommended choice. While the higher cost is a consideration, the long-term benefits of improved employee performance and skill development outweigh the initial investment.

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Hello, Harry. 
This is Jose. Thank you for reaching out regarding your concerns on how to motivate your employees. 
Frist, I recommend you to follow the ABR system, which stands for: Analyze, Benchmark and Reward. Analyze refers to review the current status on your team, for each members, this will allow you to clearly communicate your expectations while motivating your team on the setting of their objectives (this will definitely boos their motivation); B stands for Benchmarking, that is connected with the previous task: involve your team in the goal, make them feel part of the process, and lastly: reward. This mean to ensure there is a reward after success, this mean monitoring your team's performance, asses it and reward when the benchmark is reached or surpassed. You can use multiple options, such as prizes, bonus or even vouchers. 
As part of your initial query, were are some behaviors you need to avoid: 
1. Lose your temper: although as a leader you will face stressful situations, keep calm, get together and then act. Remember good leadership lead by example. 
2. Don't let your team take blame for things: even if they commit an error, do nor focus on that but in how to improve, and
3. Avoid compliment: some leaders don't compliment their teams after a success as they don't want them to "do thing because of the compliment", ignoring the fact that positive words of recognition can boost your team morale while provide feedback on their work. 

To summarize the above, connect with your team to recognize their motivation and the proper way to approach them. 

Do not hesitate to reach out again in case further questions arise. 

Regards, 

Jose

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: “El Chupacabras,” a legendary creature in Mexican and Latin American folklore, is often described as a vampiric, fearsome predator with a penchant for attacking livestock, especially goats, from which its name “chupa” (suck) and “cabra” (goat) originates. The creature first gained attention in the 1990s following reports of livestock deaths, where animals were found drained of blood with mysterious puncture wounds.

Descriptions of El Chupacabras vary widely, but common characteristics include a reptilian or alien-like appearance, spines or quills along its back, and glowing red or green eyes. It’s typically depicted as either bipedal or with a crouched, menacing stance. Some describe it as the size of a small bear, with rough, grayish-green skin and sharp claws or fangs, adding to its supernatural allure.

Despite numerous sightings and alleged encounters, no scientific evidence has been found to support its existence. However, stories of El Chupacabras continue to spread, fueled by media coverage and local folklore, making it one of Mexico’s most enduring modern legends. Its legacy persists in popular culture, embodying fears of the unknown and unexplained in rural areas.

AM

text_a: Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. Response: nan
text_b: Corporate social responsibility (CSR) has sparked considerable debate, with arguments both for and against the idea that companies should prioritize social and environmental concerns alongside profits. However, I strongly believe that CSR is not just a moral obligation—it is a business necessity. Companies exist within a broader social framework, and their operations directly impact communities, employees, and the environment. Ignoring these responsibilities can lead to public backlash, reduced consumer trust, and long-term financial losses. Businesses that engage in ethical practices—such as fair wages, sustainable sourcing, and community support—build stronger relationships with their stakeholders. As one contributor, Jack@MSU, pointed out, CSR makes good business sense because consumers care. A company that demonstrates genuine social commitment is often rewarded with customer loyalty, enhanced brand reputation, and even increased profitability. On the other hand, some argue that a corporation’s sole duty is to maximize profits for shareholders, as Milton Friedman famously stated. While profitability remains a priority,ethical business conduct can contribute to financial success rather than hinder it. Companies that embrace CSR attract top talent, reduce regulatory risks, and foster innovation by investing in sustainable solutions. Ultimately, businesses should not view CSR as a burden but as an opportunity—an investment in long-term success, societal well-being, and environmental sustainability. Responsible companies don’t just thrive; they shape a better world for future generations.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: 
Among the nine writing techniques introduced, metaphor and symbolism stand out as particularly useful due to their ability to convey complex ideas and emotions succinctly and powerfully. Metaphors allow writers to draw connections between seemingly unrelated concepts, creating vivid imagery and deeper understanding for the reader. For instance, comparing life to a journey can encapsulate the idea of progress and discovery, enriching the narrative with layers of meaning. Symbolism, similarly, imbues objects, characters, or events with additional significance, allowing writers to communicate themes and motifs subtly. This technique can elevate writing by engaging readers in deciphering hidden meanings, thus making the experience more interactive and thought-provoking.

Additionally, questioning and focused free writing are invaluable for idea generation and overcoming writer’s block. Questioning prompts writers to delve into the “why” and “how” of their subject, encouraging deeper exploration and critical thinking. Focused free writing offers a structured approach to brainstorming, enabling writers to channel their thoughts in a specific direction while maintaining creative flow. By combining these techniques, writers can develop rich, nuanced content that resonates with their audience, making them essential tools in any writer’s toolkit.

text_a: Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: Airplanes are made up of several essential parts, each serving a specific function: Fuselage: The central body of the aircraft. It houses the cockpit, cabin, and cargo, and connects all other components. Wings: These generate lift, allowing the airplane to fly. Their shape and angle help control stability and maneuverability. Tail: Located at the rear, it includes the horizontal stabilizer and vertical fin. It helps control pitch (up and down) and yaw (side to side). Engine: Provides thrust to move the airplane forward. Most commercial planes use jet engines that compress and ignite air mixed with fuel. Cabin: The passenger area inside the fuselage, equipped with seats, restrooms, and storage. Landing Gear: These are wheels or skids used during takeoff, landing, and taxiing. They retract during flight to reduce drag and extend when the plane is on the ground. Each part works together to ensure safe, stable, and efficient flight.

text_a:
Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: Language students often encounter a variety of issues and challenges that can impede their learning process. What are the most common difficulties they face, and how can these be addressed?

Firstly, language learners frequently struggle with pronunciation and accents. The phonetic differences between their native language and the target language can lead to misunderstandings and communication barriers. This challenge can be mitigated through practice and exposure to native speakers, as well as utilizing language learning tools that focus on pronunciation.

Another significant issue is the complexity of grammar and syntax. Language students often find it difficult to grasp the rules and structures of a new language, which can be vastly different from their own. To overcome this, learners can benefit from structured lessons and exercises that incrementally build their understanding, alongside practical application in conversations and writing.

Vocabulary acquisition is also a hurdle, as memorizing and retaining new words can be overwhelming. Students can address this challenge by using mnemonic devices, engaging in immersive experiences, and employing spaced repetition techniques to reinforce memory.

Additionally, cultural nuances and idiomatic expressions pose challenges, as language is deeply intertwined with culture. Students may struggle to understand context or use language appropriately. Exposure to authentic materials such as films, books, and interactions with native speakers can help bridge this gap.

Finally, motivation and confidence are crucial yet fragile elements. Language learning is a long-term commitment that requires perseverance. Encouragement from peers, setting achievable goals, and celebrating small victories can sustain motivation and boost confidence.

In summary, language students face numerous challenges, but with strategic approaches and consistent effort, these obstacles can be overcome, leading to successful language acquisition.
text_b:

text_a: Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: An airplane is a complex machine made up of several important parts, each with a specific function to ensure safe and efficient flight. The fuselage is the central part of the airplane, where the cockpit, passengers, and cargo are located. It serves as the main structure and connects all the other parts. The wings are essential for flight. They produce the lift needed to keep the airplane in the air. When air passes over and under the wings, the difference in pressure causes the airplane to rise. The tail, also called the empennage, helps maintain the stability of the airplane during flight. It is made up of vertical and horizontal surfaces that control direction (movements to the sides and up or down). The engines are responsible for generating the force called thrust, which propels the airplane forward. They can be located under the wings or at the rear of the fuselage, depending on the type of aircraft. Each of these parts works together to ensure that the airplane can take off, fly, maneuver, and land safely. Knowing its functions helps you understand how flight is possible, without any errors.

Prompt Level: 11.0 Prompt: Write a paragraph about how media has changed in your lifetime. What media was important before? What do you use now, and how has it changed your reading habits? Pay attention to your use of commas, colons and semicolons. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: In my early years, print media such as newspapers, magazines, and physical books used to be read. They were the primary sources of information and entertainment. The sound of turning pages and the scent of fresh ink were comforting constants. Television and radio also played significant roles, providing news updates and entertainment at scheduled intervals.
As technology advanced, digital media began to take over. The more use of the internet revolutionized access to information, making it instantaneous. E-books and online articles became more used, gradually replacing printed media. Social media platforms emerged, allowing for the rapid dissemination of news and fostering real-time interactions. Streaming services supplanted traditional television, offering on-demand entertainment.
This shift to digital media has profoundly altered my reading habits. While I still appreciate the reading of physical books, I now getting information through digital formats. E-readers and tablets have made reading more convenient, enabling me to carry an entire library in one device. The evolution of media has enriched my access to information but has also required me to adapt to new ways of consuming and processing content.

text_a:
Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: An airplane is made up of several essential parts that allow it to fly safely and efficiently. The fuselage is the central body of the aircraft. It houses the coclpit, where the pilots control the plane, and the cabain, where passengers and cargo are carried. The fuselage also connects all the other parts together. The wings are perhaps the most recognizable parts of an airplane. They provide the lift that allows the aircraft to leave the ground. As air flows over and under the wings, it creates a pressure difference that lifts the plane into the air. most airplanes have flaps and ailerons. on the wings to help control the aircraft during takeoff, flight, and landing.
The tail, also known as the empennage, includes the horizonatal and vertical stabilizers. These surfaces help keep the airplane stable in flight and allow the pilot to control its pich and yaw. The rudder, located on the vertical stabilizer, moves the nose left and right, while the elevators on the horizontal stabilizer control the up-and-down movement. Finaly, the engines provide the thrust neede to move the airplane forward. On jet planes, engines ar usually mounted under the wings r at the rear of the fuselage.
text_b: An airplane is made up of several essential parts that allow it to fly safely and efficiently. The fuselage is the central body of the aircraft. It houses the coclpit, where the pilots control the plane, and the cabain, where passengers and cargo are carried. The fuselage also connects all the other parts together. The wings are perhaps the most recognizable parts of an airplane. They provide the lift that allows the aircraft to leave the ground. As air flows over and under the wings, it creates a pressure difference that lifts the plane into the air. most airplanes have flaps and ailerons. on the wings to help control the aircraft during takeoff, flight, and landing. The tail, also known as the empennage, includes the horizonatal and vertical stabilizers. These surfaces help keep the airplane stable in flight and allow the pilot to control its pich and yaw. The rudder, located on the vertical stabilizer, moves the nose left and right, while the elevators on the horizontal stabilizer control the up-and-down movement. Finaly, the engines provide the thrust neede to move the airplane forward. On jet planes, engines ar usually mounted under the wings r at the rear of the fuselage.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Dragons,

Since we don’t have a local legend i’m going to talk about dragons. Since I was a young girl i’ve had a soft spot for dragons, can you imagine what it must be like to meet one?

Imagine going on a multi day hike in a mountainous area with lots of evergreen trees. It’s quite late and getting dark so you decide to set up your tent and have some dinner. You enjoy the fire and keep yourself warm until you’re tired enough to sleep. Once you’re in the tent it starts raining so you fall asleep to the sound of the raindrops. 

The next morning you wake up and start looking around, it’s still a bit misty but you can spot a cave in the distance. Once you’ve finished your breakfast and have packed up your tent you decide to head in the direction of the cave. 

Suddenly there’s a loud thump behind you, you turn around and what do you see? The dragon from the Shrek movies, staring at you with her pink eyes!

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: As there were a few problems with Cessna 123's landing, you have been asked to write a report by your superiors. Write the report below. Write 100 - 150 words. Response: Incident Report: Landing Issues with Cessna 123
Date: 17.11.2024
Aircraft: Cessna 123
Location: Nordfjallet, Norway
Weather Conditions: Heavy rain and strong crosswinds
Summary: On 17.12.2024 the Cessna 123 experienced significant challenges during landing due to terrible weather conditions, specifically heavy rain and strong crosswinds. These conditions caused several issues that impacted the safety and stability of the landing process.
Details:
1.	Heavy Rain:
o	The heavy rain reduced visibility significantly, making it difficult for the pilot to have a clear view of the runway and surrounding environment.

2.	Strong Crosswinds:
o	The strong crosswinds created additional challenges in maintaining the aircraft’s alignment with the runway centerline.

Recommendations:
•	Pilot Training: Extend pilot training programs to include more practice in handling landings under difficult weather conditions, particularly heavy rain and strong crosswinds.
•	Weather Monitoring: Improve weather monitoring and forecasting systems to provide more accurate information to pilots and air traffic controllers.

These conditions caused several issues that impacted the safety and stability of the landing process. Details: 1. Heavy Rain: o The heavy rain reduced visibility significantly, making it difficult for the pilot to have a clear view of the runway and surrounding environment. 2. Strong Crosswinds: o The strong crosswinds created additional challenges in maintaining the aircraft’s alignment with the runway centerline. Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The concept of celebrity often perpetuates an unhealthy obsession with wealth, beauty, and status, overshadowing more meaningful contributions to society. For example, many celebrities are criticized for their excessive lifestyles, flaunting their privilege while being disconnected from the struggles of everyday people. A glaring issue is the way some celebrities use their platforms irresponsibly, spreading misinformation or promoting harmful trends simply to remain relevant. This behavior not only undermines their influence but can also negatively impact their audience, particularly impressionable young fans.  

While it’s undeniable that some celebrities use their fame for good—advocating for important causes or donating to charities—the culture of idolizing individuals based on superficial attributes often prioritizes entertainment over substance. This phenomenon shifts public attention away from critical issues, such as social injustice or environmental challenges. Furthermore, the idea that celebrities are role models is problematic, as many of them make mistakes like anyone else, yet their actions are magnified, sometimes sending the wrong message.  

Ultimately, while celebrity culture isn’t inherently bad, its emphasis on fame over integrity and values needs to be reassessed to promote a more balanced and meaningful societal focus.

text_a: Prompt Level: 14.0 Prompt: Using your notes, draft a speech with a consistent metaphor. Add variety by using different terms for teams and problems. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: **Opening:** Ladies and gentlemen, today we celebrate a significant milestone: the renewal of our partnership with Crum. This achievement is a testament to our unwavering commitment to excellence. We are particularly honored that Crum has recognized and praised our dedication to quality. **Body:** Three months ago, we found ourselves navigating through turbulent waters. We encountered unresolved defects that threatened to sink our ship. These issues, coupled with other minor technical glitches, created a storm of challenges. However, our crew remained steadfast and resilient. To steer our vessel back on course, we implemented strategic changes. We revamped our update delivery system, ensuring smoother and more efficient rollouts. This adjustment has significantly reduced the occurrence of defects, stabilizing our journey. Additionally, we fortified our Quality Assurance processes. By introducing more rigorous testing protocols and continuous monitoring, we have been able to identify and resolve issues before they impact our customers. **Closing:** As we sail into the future, our commitment to providing unwavering support remains strong. We will continue to navigate these waters with diligence, ensuring that our customers, like Crum, receive the best possible experience. With these improvements, we are confident that our partnership will not only endure but thrive, steering us towards new horizons of success. Thank you.

text_a: Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Now prepare the content for an informative web page about counterfeit goods. Be sure to keep the following points in mind: Types of counterfeit goods, the effect of counterfeiting on society, the signs of a fake, what to do if you discover fake goods.  Write 250-300 words. Response: nan
text_b: Counterfeit Goods: What You Need to Know Counterfeit goods are fake products designed to look like genuine brand-name items. While they may seem like a bargain, they pose serious risks to consumers, businesses, and society as a whole. Types of Counterfeit Goods Counterfeit products can be found in almost every industry, including: - Fashion & Accessories – Fake designer bags, watches, and shoes - Electronics – Imitation smartphones, chargers, and batteries - Pharmaceuticals – Counterfeit medicine with unknown or harmful ingredients - Cosmetics & Perfumes – Knock-off beauty products that may contain unsafe chemicals - Food & Beverages – Fake alcohol, baby formula, and other consumables - Software & Media – Pirated DVDs, games, and software The Impact of Counterfeiting Buying counterfeit goods supports illegal businesses and harms legitimate companies. It can also: - Endanger consumers – Fake electronics may cause fires, counterfeit medicines can be ineffective or toxic, and knock-off beauty products can contain harmful chemicals. - Hurt the economy – Counterfeit sales result in lost jobs and tax revenue. - Fund criminal activities – Many counterfeiting networks are linked to organized crime and human trafficking. How to Spot a Fake - Price too good to be true? Counterfeit goods are often sold at unrealistically low prices. - Poor quality – Fake products may have cheap materials, misspelled labels, or inconsistent logos. - No official packaging – Genuine brands use high-quality packaging with security features like holograms or serial numbers. - Unverified sellers – Buying from unauthorized websites or street markets increases the risk of counterfeits. What to Do If You Find Counterfeit Goods - Avoid buying them – Supporting counterfeit markets fuels illegal activity. - Report the seller – Contact consumer protection agencies or the brand owner. - Warn others – Share your experience to prevent others from being misled. Stay informed and shop wisely to protect yourself and support ethical businesses.

Prompt Level: 14.0 Prompt: Using your notes, draft a speech with a consistent metaphor. Add variety by using different terms for teams and problems. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Hey everyone,

Great news we’ve just renewed our partnership with Crum! That’s a big win, and even better, they specifically called out our dedication to quality. That kind of feedback doesn’t come easy, so it’s a real credit to the work you’ve all been putting in.

Now, let’s be honest it wasn’t all smooth sailing. A few months back, we hit some bumps with unresolved defects that caused some friction. We also had a handful of other tech hiccups that didn’t help.

But we didn’t just sit back. We changed how we deliver updates to make things smoother and faster, and we tightened up our QA process to catch more issues before they ever reach a customer. And clearly, it paid off.

Looking ahead, we’re going to stay on top of this. Crum and all our customers deserve a team that’s proactive, not reactive. So let’s keep the momentum going, keep learning, and keep showing them what we’re made of.

Thanks, everyone.
text_b: Hey everyone, Great news we’ve just renewed our partnership with Crum! That’s a big win, and even better, they specifically called out our dedication to quality. That kind of feedback doesn’t come easy, so it’s a real credit to the work you’ve all been putting in. Now, let’s be honestit wasn’t all smooth sailing. A few months back, we hit some bumps with unresolved defects that caused some friction. We also had a handful of other tech hiccups that didn’t help. But we didn’t just sit back. We changed how we deliver updates to make things smoother and faster, and we tightened up our QA process to catch more issues before they ever reach a customer. And clearly, it paid off. Looking ahead, we’re going to stay on top of this. Crum and all our customers deserve a team that’s proactive, not reactive. So let’s keep the momentum going, keep learning, and keep showing them what we’re made of. Thanks, everyone.

Prompt Level: 11.0 Prompt: Read the blog about a law in Japan, then write about a law in your country. Type in the input box. Write 60-90 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: India has a vast and complex legal system with numerous laws covering various aspects of life. One of the most significant laws in India is the Right to Information Act, 2005 (RTI Act). This legislation is pivotal in promoting transparency and accountability in the functioning of the government.

**Right to Information Act, 2005**

**Overview:**
The Right to Information Act was enacted by the Parliament of India in June 2005 and came into force on October 12, 2005. The act is designed to empower citizens to seek information from public authorities, thereby promoting transparency and accountability in the workings of every public authority.

**Objectives:**
The main objectives of the RTI Act are to:

1. Ensure transparency and accountability in the functioning of public authorities.
2. Empower citizens to access information under the control of public authorities.
3. Promote openness and reduce corruption in government and its instrumentalities.

**Key Provisions:**
- **Right to Information:** Citizens have the right to request information from public authorities, which are required to reply expeditiously or within thirty days.
- **Public Authorities:** The act covers all constitutional authorities, including executive, judiciary, and legislature bodies, as well as any institution or body established by an act of Parliament or a state legislature.
- **Exemptions:** There are certain exemptions to the disclosure of information to protect national security, privacy, and other sensitive matters.
- **Procedure:** The act lays down a simple procedure for obtaining information. Citizens can file a request in writing or electronically, and the public authority is required to respond within a specified time frame.
- **Information Commissioners:** The act provides for the appointment of a Central Information Commission and State Information Commissions to handle appeals and complaints related to the RTI requests.

**Impact:**
The RTI Act has been instrumental in promoting transparency and accountability in government operations. It has empowered citizens to participate more actively in governance by enabling them to obtain information about public policies, decisions, and expenditures. The act has also played a significant role in uncovering corruption and maladministration.

**Challenges:**
Despite its success, the RTI Act faces several challenges, including:
- Delays in information dissemination due to bureaucratic hurdles.
- Lack of awareness among citizens about their rights under the act.
- Instances of harassment and threats to RTI activists.

Overall, the Right to Information Act, 2005, is a landmark legislation in India's legal framework, promoting greater transparency and accountability in the functioning of public authorities and enhancing the democratic process.

text_b: When handing over the watch, it is essential to provide a full and clear briefing. Begin with the ship’s current position, course, speed, and any planned movements. Mention the vessel’s draft and any known shallow waters or hazards in the area. Report on traffic nearby, including the position and movement of other vessels. Update the oncoming officer on the state of the equipment—both on the bridge and in the engine room—noting any faults or irregularities. Include the status of navigational aids, radar, AIS, GPS, and radiocommunications. Mention the weather conditions, including wind, visibility, and sea state. Refer to standing orders, company policies, or any special instructions from the master. Highlight any unusual events, such as drills, maintenance, or alarms. Finally, ensure that all logs are up to date and available for review. Confirm that the oncoming officer understands all details before leaving the watch.

text_b: NAFTA, which stands for the North American Free Trade Agreement, is a trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico. It came into force in January 1994 after several years of negotiation. The main goal of NAFTA was to reduce or eliminate customs duties and other trade barriers among the three member countries. This made it easier and more affordable to exchange goods and services across their borders. NAFTA has had a significant impact on trade relations in the region, particularly in the agricultural sector. For example, it allowed Mexican fruits and vegetables to be exported more easily to the United States, boosting trade and availability of fresh produce. While the agreement has had both positive and negative effects on the member countries, it is generally considered beneficial to all three economies. It encouraged economic cooperation, increased trade, and contributed to stronger economic ties in countries of North America.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b:
<input>When I was a kid, I would frequently go to my grandparents' house in the Portuguese countryside, to a village called Benedita. I keep many memories from that time, one of them being my grandmother trying to put me and my sister to bed, waiting for us to fall asleep. In those moments, she would talk to us about "João Pestana" ("John Eyelash," in a literal English translation). The way my grandmother used to say, "Let's go to bed, because João Pestana must be arriving soon!" in such a tender voice, left me with no doubt about the good nature of this man.

And now that I am a grown-up woman, with some research done about this fictional character, I can say that I was right: João Pestana is indeed a shy and calm Portuguese mythical figure of sleep that only comes when everything is deeply silent. He may be compared to the well-known "Sandman" in other Anglo-Saxon cultures. At the moment he arrives, children close their eyelashes (hence the name) and fall into a deep sleep. That's why no one has ever seen him.

In Portugal, we have many songs (lullabies) and popular poems about João Pestana. To my grandmother, a big thank you for having brought them to me. Coincidence or not, I’ve always had an easy and very good sleep.

See you soon, João Pestana!</input>

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: In my country, robots are increasingly being used in various sectors, especially in manufacturing, healthcare, and customer service. In factories, robots assist in assembling products with precision and speed, reducing human error and increasing productivity. In hospitals, robotic surgical systems help doctors perform delicate procedures with greater accuracy, while service robots in banks, malls, and airports assist customers with basic tasks and information. I feel both impressed and cautious about this growing presence of robots. On the one hand, they can improve efficiency, safety, and convenience in our daily lives. On the other hand, I worry about the potential loss of jobs and overdependence on machines. As robots take on more roles, society may benefit from reduced labor costs and improved quality of services, but this shift could also widen economic inequality and lead to social challenges. Overall, robots can bring positive change if used responsibly, with proper policies to protect workers and ensure ethical use of technology.

I feel both impressed and cautious about this growing presence of robots. On the one hand, they can improve efficiency, safety, and convenience in our daily lives. On the other hand, I worry about the potential loss of jobs and overdependence on machines. As robots take on more roles, society may benefit from reduced labor costs and improved quality of services, but this shift could also widen economic inequality and lead to social challenges. text_b: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulates drugs and medical treatments in the United States to ensure safety and effectiveness. Drugs sold over-the-counter (OTC) are deemed safe for unsupervised use, while prescription drugs require medical oversight. Since the early 1900s, laws like the Pure Food and Drug Act and the Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act have enforced drug safety and efficacy. The FDA also monitors drug manufacturing and labeling, ensuring public access to safe treatments. Recent legislation mandates warning labels on OTC medications like acetaminophen, which can cause liver damage when misused with alcohol.

text_a: Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is a significant trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico. It came into effect in January 1994 after several years of negotiation. The primary goal of NAFTA was to reduce or eliminate customs duties and other trade barriers among the three countries, making it easier and more cost-effective to import and export goods across borders. NAFTA has had a major impact on trade relationships in North America, particularly in the agricultural sector. For instance, it allowed for an increased flow of Mexican fruits and vegetables into the United States, giving American consumers access to a wider range of products at competitive prices. While the agreement has brought economic benefits, such as increased trade volumes and stronger economic ties, it has also faced criticism. Some industries and workers have experienced negative effects, including job losses due to companies relocating production to lower-cost regions. Despite these challenges, NAFTA is generally seen as beneficial for all three member countries. It has helped create a more integrated and competitive North American market, encouraging investment, innovation, and cooperation.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: nan
text_b: Metaphor and symbolism are among the most powerful literary techniques because they allow writers to convey complex ideas, emotions, and themes in ways that resonate deeply with readers. By drawing comparisons or embedding meaning in objects, actions, or characters, these techniques make abstract concepts more tangible and memorable. A metaphor can distill a complicated feeling or situation into a single vivid image, helping readers grasp nuance without lengthy explanation. For example, describing grief as a “storm” conveys its intensity, unpredictability, and emotional weight far more effectively than a literal description. Symbolism, similarly, can layer meaning into a story, enriching the narrative and encouraging readers to think beyond the surface. A recurring symbol—a broken clock, a bird in a cage—can subtly reinforce themes of time, freedom, or constraint. These devices also engage readers’ imaginations, inviting them to interpret and uncover hidden meanings, thus making the reading experience more interactive and emotionally impactful. In essence, metaphor and symbolism bridge the gap between language and experience, making them indispensable tools for any writer seeking to evoke deeper understanding.

text_a: Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Robots are becoming increasingly common in various industries across my country, revolutionizing the way tasks are performed. In manufacturing, robots assemble products with precision and efficiency, reducing costs and increasing production speed. In healthcare, robotic-assisted surgeries allow for greater accuracy, while robotic exoskeletons help patients regain mobility. Service robots are also used in restaurants, hotels, and even customer service roles. While I find this technological advancement fascinating, I also have mixed feelings about the rapid integration of robots. On the positive side, robots improve productivity, enhance safety by handling dangerous tasks, and provide assistance in areas like elderly care. However, there are concerns about job displacement, as automation may replace human workers in certain industries. Additionally, over-reliance on robots could lead to a loss of critical skills and reduced human interaction. Society must find a balance embracing robotics for their benefits while ensuring that people are not left behind. Education and job retraining programs can help workers adapt to this evolving landscape.

text_a:
Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: An airplane is made up of several important parts, each with a specific function to help the aircraft fly safely and efficiently. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane. It holds the cockpit, where the pilots sit, and the cabin, where passengers and cargo are stored. It connects all other parts of the aircraft.

The wings are essential for lift. As the airplane moves forward, air flows over and under the wings, creating lift that allows the airplane to rise off the ground. Most airplanes have two wings, one on each side of the fuselage.

At the back of the airplane is the tail, which includes the horizontal and vertical stabilizers. The tail helps keep the airplane stable during flight and controls the direction in which it moves. The vertical stabilizer keeps the plane from yawing side to side, while the horizontal stabilizer keeps it from pitching up or down.

The engines provide the power needed for flight. They push the airplane forward, allowing the wings to generate lift. Some airplanes have engines under the wings, while others have them at the rear of the fuselage.

Together, these parts work in harmony to ensure a safe flight.
text_b:

It holds the cockpit, where the pilots sit, and the cabin, where passengers and cargo are stored. It connects all other parts of the aircraft.

The wings are essential for lift. As the airplane moves forward, air flows over and under the wings, creating lift that allows the airplane to rise off the ground. Most airplanes have two wings, one on each side of the fuselage.

At the back of the airplane is the tail, which includes the horizontal and vertical stabilizers. The tail helps keep the airplane stable during flight and controls the direction in which it moves. The vertical stabilizer keeps the plane from yawing side to side, while the horizontal stabilizer keeps it from pitching up or down.

The engines provide the power needed for flight. They push the airplane forward, allowing the wings to generate lift. Some airplanes have engines under the wings, while others have them at the rear of the fuselage.

Together, these parts work in harmony to ensure a safe flight.</input>

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your friend is about to open a secondhand clothes shop. He doesn’t have much capital, and is renting a very old building. He has got a few quotes for property and liability insurance, but they have been very high. He asks you to do a risk assessment of the premises. Have a look at your checklist, then write him an email advising him of the changes he has to make. Write 150-200 words. Response: Subject: Risk Assessment and Recommendations for Insurance

Hi Dave,

I’ve gone through the checklist and conducted a risk assessment of the building you’re renting for the shop. To reduce insurance costs and improve safety, here are some changes you should consider:

Exterior:
	•	Fix the loose bricks and clear the blocked drainpipes. These could cause accidents and water damage, increasing your liability.
	•	Tidy up the yard and declutter the sidewalk to prevent potential trip hazards for customers.
	•	Address the leaky roof as it could lead to property damage and mold, both of which will raise your risk profile.

Interior:
	•	Improve the lighting to reduce accident risks and create a more welcoming environment.
	•	Remove or properly store loose chemicals, as they pose serious safety hazards.
	•	Replace the old fire extinguishers with new ones that meet current standards.
	•	Organize the stacked boxes to prevent falls and injuries.

While you may not be able to address all these issues at once, tackling the high-priority items should make a significant difference. These improvements will not only lower insurance premiums but also ensure the safety of your customers and staff.

Let me know if you need help prioritizing the tasks or finding contractors!

Best regards,
Sandra

Interior: • Improve the lighting to reduce accident risks and create a more welcoming environment. • Remove or properly store loose chemicals, as they pose serious safety hazards. • Replace the old fire extinguishers with new ones that meet current standards. • Organize the stacked boxes to prevent falls and injuries. While you may not be able to address all these issues at once, tackling the high-priority items should make a significant difference. These improvements will not only lower insurance premiums but also ensure the safety of your customers and staff. Let me know if you need help prioritizing the tasks or finding contractors!
